thread.title: Vodafone’s Cobra bites back in fight against car crime
thread.title_full: Vodafone’s Cobra bites back in fight against car crime

title: Vodafone’s Cobra bites back in fight against car crime
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Vodafone’s Cobra bites back in fight against car crime Vodafone bought Cobra Automotive Technologies last year Robyn Beck/AFP/Getty Images Published at 12:01AM, October 26 2015 A vehicle tracking app could put the telecoms giant in the technology fast lane 
As car jackings go, this one is a breeze. I reach inside the open window of the Porsche Panamera, unlock it and speed off around Lake Varese on a joy ride. 
Around 30 seconds later a mobile phone goes off and my hostage, sitting in the back, answers nervously that his car has been stolen. It is only his use of the code word “cobra” that stops the Vodafone operatives on the other end of the line from sending the carabinieri after me. 
It’s hardly Grand Theft Auto but it illustrates how Vodafone has quietly moved into the automotive market Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
